data.title: Mental Health Resources
data.meta_description: Mental Health Resources - Fremont Union High School District
data.text:
You can request to speak with a School Based Therapist or School Psychologist by filling out our FUHSD Wellness Check-In Form for your school site. We take appointments during regular school hours, Monday-Friday from 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

If this is a medical or mental health emergency, DO NOT fill out this form. Call 911 or visit your nearest hospital emergency room if you can get there safely You can also contact the Crisis Resources listed below directly.

Cupertino HS

Fremont HS

Homestead HS

Lynbrook HS

Monta Vista HS

Educational Options

If you are accessing this page because you are having a mental health emergency please call 911 or a medical professional.

General Mental Health Resources

Toll-free Mental Health Call Center: 800-704-0900

Mental Health Urgent Care (MHUC) Walk-in: 408-885-7855

YWCA of Silicon Valley

National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) Santa Clara County: 408-453-0400

Self-help Centers: Zephyr – 408-792-2140; Esperanza – 408-852-2460

Trans Lifeline: 877-565-8860

Center for Living with Dying

Allcove Palo Alto

988 Informational Flyer

Downtown Youth Wellness Center (725 E. Santa Clara Street, Suite 105, San Jose)

Suicide Prevention & Student Support Phone Lines

American Foundation for Suicide Prevention

Crisis Text Line: Text “LISTEN” to 741741

National Suicide Prevention Hotline/Suicide and Crisis Lifeline (24 Hour): 800-273-TALK (8255) or 988

Santa Clara County 24 Hour Suicide & Crisis Hotline: 1-855-278-4204

Bill Wilson Youth Hotline (24-hours Suicide & Crisis Line): 408-850-6125

Sexual Assault, Rape and Domestic Violence Support

Rape Crisis Hot Line (24-hour): 650-493-7273

YWCA Silicon Valley Sexual Assault and Domestic Violence Support Line: 800-572-2782

National Domestic Violence Hotline: 800-799-7233, text 'START' to 88788

Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network: rainn.org

National Sexual Assault Hotline: Call & Text: 1-800-656-4673

National Human Trafficking Hotline: Call: 1-888-373-7888 or Text: 233733

Substance Abuse Treatment Services

Substance Use Treatment - Gateway: 800-488-9919

FUHSD Interventions for Drug & Alcohol Abuse

Department of Social Services - Child Protective Services

Eating Disorders Helpline: Chat, Call & Text: 800-931-2237

National Eating Disorders Association (NEDA): www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/

Stop Bullying.Gov

Bill Wilson Center

Emergency Food & Shelter

Homeless Helpline operated by HomeFirst: 408-510-7600

Norte del Condado: 650-494-8420

Sur del Condado: 408-683-2482

Parent/Guardian Support

Uplift (EMQ) Crisis Team (Santa Clara County) provides free in-home suicide assessment and safety planning: 408-379-9085 or 1-877-412-7474

COVID-19 Support

The California Parent and Youth Helpline provides support and resource referrals to parent and youth during the current COVID-19 pandemic, 7-days a week from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Call or text 1-855-4APARENT (855-427-2736) for services in English, Spanish and other languages. For more information, please visit the Youth Helpline website.

CARE SOLACE PARTNERSHIP for locating mental health services

We continue to partner with Care Solace, an online resource meant to assist individuals in finding local mental health related programs and counseling services.

The preferred method for FUHSD students and families to access Care Solace services is by contacting our School Linked Services Specialist Jasmine Kroner at jasmine_kroner@fuhsd.org or 408-522-2288 x4056. Our administrators, guidance counselors, school-based therapists and psychologists can assist in making a referral to School Linked Services.

Care Solace may also be accessed by:

Calling (888) 515-0595 to speak with someone from the Care Solace Concierge team

Visiting our custom direct link at www.caresolace.com/FUHSD

FUHSD's continued partnership with Care Solace has been made possible through funding from the Fremont Union High Schools Foundation.
